pull_request.title: fix(docs): Add JavaScript web app frontend guide
pull_request.body: This is the guide for building a JavaScript chat application frontend. It also adds the styles to the deployment so that we can link to them from the https://github.com/feathersjs/feathers-chat repository.

issue.title: Quickstart code not compiling
issue.body:
### Steps to reproduce

(First please check that this issue is not already solved as [described
here](https://github.com/feathersjs/feathers/blob/crow/.github/contributing.md#report-a-bug))

- [ ] I followed the [quickstart](https://dove.feathersjs.com/guides/basics/starting.html) but cannot compile the code for the [second Part 'An API Server'](https://dove.feathersjs.com/guides/basics/starting.html#an-api-server)
- [ ] Install dependencies
```
npm init --yes
# Install TypeScript and its NodeJS wrapper
npm i typescript ts-node --save-dev
# Also initialize a TS configuration file that uses modern JavaScript
npx tsc --init --target es2020

npm install @feathersjs/feathers@pre --save
npm install @feathersjs/socketio@pre @feathersjs/koa@pre --save

```
- [ ] Run sample code from quickstart page `npx ts-node app.ts`
 
### Expected behavior
The server should start. Removing the dependency on `serveStatic`makes the example work just fine.

### Actual behavior
A TypeScript error is thrown:
```
Computer:feathers-quickstart-guide-test tobias$ npx ts-node app.ts
[...]/feathers-quickstart-guide-test/node_modules/ts-node/src/index.ts:859
    return new TSError(diagnosticText, diagnosticCodes, diagnostics);
           ^
TSError: ⨯ Unable to compile TypeScript:
app.ts:2:47 - error TS2305: Module '"@feathersjs/koa"' has no exported member 'serveStatic'.

2 import { koa, rest, bodyParser, errorHandler, serveStatic } from '@feathersjs/koa'
                                                ~~~~~~~~~~~

    at createTSError ([...]/feathers-quickstart-guide-test/node_modules/ts-node/src/index.ts:859:12)
    at reportTSError ([...]/feathers-quickstart-guide-test/node_modules/ts-node/src/index.ts:863:19)
    at getOutput ([...]/feathers-quickstart-guide-test/node_modules/ts-node/src/index.ts:1077:36)
    at Object.compile ([...]/feathers-quickstart-guide-test/node_modules/ts-node/src/index.ts:1433:41)
    at Module.m._compile ([...]/feathers-quickstart-guide-test/node_modules/ts-node/src/index.ts:1617:30)
    at Module._extensions..js (node:internal/modules/cjs/loader:1213:10)
    at Object.require.extensions.<computed> [as .ts] ([...]/feathers-quickstart-guide-test/node_modules/ts-node/src/index.ts:1621:12)
    at Module.load (node:internal/modules/cjs/loader:1037:32)
    at Function.Module._load (node:internal/modules/cjs/loader:878:12)
    at Function.executeUserEntryPoint [as runMain] (node:internal/modules/run_main:82:12) {
  diagnosticCodes: [ 2305 ]
}
```

### System configuration

Tell us about the applicable parts of your setup.

**Module versions** (especially the part that's not working):
```
{
  "name": "feathers-quickstart-guide-test",
  "version": "1.0.0",
  "description": "",
  "main": "index.js",
  "scripts": {
    "test": "echo \"Error: no test specified\" && exit 1"
  },
  "keywords": [],
  "author": "",
  "license": "ISC",
  "devDependencies": {
    "ts-node": "^10.9.1",
    "typescript": "^4.8.4"
  },
  "dependencies": {
    "@feathersjs/koa": "^5.0.0-pre.31",
    "@feathersjs/socketio": "^5.0.0-pre.31"
  }
```

**NodeJS version**:
v19.0.0, via nvm

**Operating System**:
MacOS 12.5.1 (21G83), Intel

**Browser Version**:

**React Native Version**:

**Module Loader**:

issue.body:
### Steps to reproduce

(First please check that this issue is not already solved as [described
here](https://github.com/feathersjs/feathers/blob/crow/.github/contributing.md#report-a-bug))

comment.body: This has been fixed with the release of `5.0.0-pre.32`. I pushed the guide updated before making the prerelease 😆

payload.description: The API and real-time application framework

release.name: v5.0.0-pre.32
release.body:
# [5.0.0-pre.32](https://github.com/feathersjs/feathers/compare/v5.0.0-pre.31...v5.0.0-pre.32) (2022-10-26)


### Bug Fixes

* **authentication:** Improve logout and disconnect connection handling ([#2813](https://github.com/feathersjs/feathers/issues/2813)) ([dd77379](https://github.com/feathersjs/feathers/commit/dd77379d8bdcd32d529bef912e672639e4899823))
* **cli:** Ensure code injection points are not code style dependent ([#2832](https://github.com/feathersjs/feathers/issues/2832)) ([0776e26](https://github.com/feathersjs/feathers/commit/0776e26bfe4c1df9d2786499941bd3faba1715c0))
* **cli:** Only generate authentication setup when selected ([#2823](https://github.com/feathersjs/feathers/issues/2823)) ([7d219d9](https://github.com/feathersjs/feathers/commit/7d219d9c5269267b50f3ce99a5653d645f9927c1))
* **docs:** Review transport API docs and update Express middleware setup ([#2811](https://github.com/feathersjs/feathers/issues/2811)) ([1b97f14](https://github.com/feathersjs/feathers/commit/1b97f14d474f5613482f259eeaa585c24fcfab43))
* **schema:** Improve resolver performance ([#2822](https://github.com/feathersjs/feathers/issues/2822)) ([5fa900f](https://github.com/feathersjs/feathers/commit/5fa900f90d55859332c90283dddddab26ae3759c))
* **schema:** Use the same options for resolveData hook ([#2833](https://github.com/feathersjs/feathers/issues/2833)) ([ed3b050](https://github.com/feathersjs/feathers/commit/ed3b05051db6886729d4824825ca8f00c2459af7))
* **transports:** Add remaining middleware for generated apps to Koa and Express ([#2796](https://github.com/feathersjs/feathers/issues/2796)) ([0d5781a](https://github.com/feathersjs/feathers/commit/0d5781a5c72a0cbb2ec8211bfa099f0aefe115a2))


### Features

* **cli:** Add authentication client to generated client ([#2801](https://github.com/feathersjs/feathers/issues/2801)) ([bd59f91](https://github.com/feathersjs/feathers/commit/bd59f91b45a01c2eea0c4386e567f4de5aa6ad99))
* **docs:** New website and documentation pages ([#2802](https://github.com/feathersjs/feathers/issues/2802)) ([ae85fa2](https://github.com/feathersjs/feathers/commit/ae85fa216f12f7ff5d15e7039640e27a09989ea4))
release.short_description_html:
5.0.0-pre.32 (2022-10-26)

Bug Fixes

  • authentication: Improve logout and disconnect connection handling (#2813) (dd77379)
  • cli: Ensure code injection points are not code style dependent (#2832) (0776e26

The footer of the new docs looks like this on mobile:

![Screenshot_20221021-063803_Chrome](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22286818/197113419-35347a23-123f-499e-bd19-1feca11fd1e2.jpg)

System: Android
Device: Samsung S21 FE
Browser: Webview (Samsung Browser (?) and Android Chrome)

commits.message: fix(schema): Use the same options for resolveData hook (#2833)

issue.title: resolveData uses the wrong input parameters
issue.body:
### Steps to reproduce

1. Create multiple data resolvers.
2. Attempt to consume them in hooks with the following:
```js
schemaHooks.resolveData(
          baseDataResolver,
          secondDataResolver
)
```

### Expected behavior
Using the code above, it should accept an array of resolvers.

### Actual behavior
When using the code block above, there is an error that `resolveData` can only accept 1 parameter.

### System configuration

Feathers `pre.31` packages.

## Source code problem
As it can be seen in the source, `resolveData` only accepts a single input. It does not allow an array of resolvers like the other resolve functions.
https://github.com/feathersjs/feathers/blob/dove/packages/schema/src/hooks/resolve.ts#L76

pull_request.title: fix(schema): Use the same options for resolveData hook
pull_request.body:
This pull request makes sure that the `resolveData` hook takes the same options as the other resolver hooks and makes sure that it works with custom methods.

Closes https://github.com/feathersjs/feathers/issues/2831

issue.title: dove: Error injecting during generate app
issue.body:
### Steps to reproduce
1. In a folder, create a folder `feathers-test`, and a `.prettierrc` file.
2. Add the text content "{}" (an empty dictionary) into the `.prettierrc` file.
3. `cd` into the `feathers-test` folder, and run `feathers generate app`.
4. An error should be encountered: 
`Error: Could not find line 'from '@feathersjs/feathers'' in file src\client.ts to inject content after`

### Expected behavior
An error should not be thrown and the generation of files should proceed.

### Actual behavior
An error is thrown and the app generation stops.

### System configuration
The above was found on 5.0.0-pre.31 of @feathersjs/cli

First device:
- Windows 10.0.19043 Build 19043
- NodeJS: v14.17.5

Second device:
- WSL
- Ubuntu 22.04
- NodeJS: v14.20.0
